title: Shirahoshi is the Ancient Weapon Poseidon
theoryText: Many fans theorized after Shirahoshi's debut that she might be connected to the Ancient Weapon Poseidon, especially given the emphasis on her importance and the 10 years of threats from Vander Decken. The theory suggested that Poseidon wasn't a weapon or object, but rather a living being with the power to control Sea Kings, and that Shirahoshi was this weapon.
author: Multiple One Piece fans and theorists

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: This theory is later confirmed in the Fish-Man Island arc, spoiling major reveals about Shirahoshi's true nature and the Ancient Weapons.

popularity.metric: Widely discussed theory that was later confirmed

title: Vander Decken's Connection to the Ancient Ship Noah
theoryText: After episode 532 showed Vander Decken meeting Hody Jones at the ancient ship Noah, fans theorized that Decken's family (the Vander Decken lineage) had a historical connection to Noah. The theory suggested that the Vander Decken family has been searching for something related to Noah for generations, and that Decken IX's obsession with Shirahoshi might be connected to Noah's true purpose and the Ancient Weapon Poseidon.
author: One Piece theory community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Contains speculation about Noah's purpose that connects to later revelations in the Fish-Man Island arc

popularity.metric: Popular theory discussed across multiple platforms

title: Hody and Decken's Alliance Will Fail Due to Incompatible Goals
theoryText: Immediately after episode 532 aired, fans theorized that the alliance between Hody Jones and Vander Decken IX would ultimately fail because their goals were fundamentally incompatible. Hody wanted to destroy Fish-Man Island and kill all humans, while Decken wanted to possess Shirahoshi (or kill her if he couldn't have her). Fans predicted that Decken's obsession with Shirahoshi would eventually conflict with Hody's plans, leading to betrayal.
author: One Piece fan community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory about the alliance's eventual breakdown, which is confirmed later in the arc

popularity.metric: Common prediction among fans following the episode

title: Luffy Will Help Shirahoshi Overcome Her Fears
theoryText: After seeing the interaction between Luffy and Shirahoshi in episode 532, fans theorized that Luffy's blunt personality and fearless nature would be exactly what Shirahoshi needed to overcome her decade of fear and isolation. The theory suggested that Luffy calling her a 'weakling crybaby' wasn't cruel, but rather the catalyst for her character growth, and that by the end of the arc, she would become much braver.
author: One Piece fan analysts
